ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: If someone was interested in entering a PhD program for the study of early or late Christianity, I would highly recommend the class, if not, I would probably discourage them from taking it

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The material produced by myself and fellow students for this course will continue to be a valuable repository for my own research and for teaching, and the theoretical approaches discussed will continue to shape my research. I found a superbly interesting project as a result of this course which has already turned into a large-scale research interest, but even if that were not the case I would be quite pleased with the breadth of subfields to which I gained access as a result of Dr. Davis' course.
